N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 924.0 - Introductory

State Regulations
(a) The rules and
regulations for reporting accidents by railroad corporations in this Part are
applicable to all railroad corporations, tourist railroads or persons operating
standard gauge railroad passenger cars or freight cars modified to transport
passengers for a fee throughout the State of New York. This Part does not apply
to any system operated by the Niagara Frontier Transporation Authority, Metropolitan Transportation Authority or any affiliate or subsidiary thereof
exercising any power granted under the Public Authorities Law section 1266. Nothing in this Part modifies any reporting requirements of the State Public

Transportation Safety Board in Part 990 of this Title. (b) Reports of accidents shall be provided by
telephone accordiang to section
924.1
and by mail according to
section
924.2
of this Part. Notes
